quotes.quote: Materialistic things bring forth some pleasurable moments, but never a sample of happiness.
The prospect of being immortal doesn't excite me, but the prospect of being a materialistic idol for four years does appeal.
If I'm a lush at anything, it's food and drink. I'm not materialistic in any way, but I value food.
As human beings, we're very materialistic and have all this stuff furs and cars and diamonds and money.
I'm not materialistic. I believe in presents from the heart, like a drawing that a child does.
Anything you cannot relinquish when it has outlived its usefulness possesses you, and in this materialistic age a great many of us are possessed by our possessions.
We are too involved in materialistic things, and they don't satisfy us. The loving relationships we have, the universe around us, we take these things for granted.
The very poor are strictly materialistic. It takes money to be a mystic.
A materialistic world will not be won to Christ by a materialistic church.
The fact remains that the materialistic view is a truncated view of reality.
The entire money structure and materialistic society is a false society.
If you are really a product of a materialistic universe, how is it that you don't feel at home there?
A materialistic person is ruthless with other people but kind to himself. A spiritual person is ruthless with himself but kind to everybody else.
Today, society is sacrificing love, values and dharma in its pursuit of materialistic gains.
The materialistic point of view in psychology can claim, at best, only the value of an heuristic hypothesis.
The adornment of the body is a human need. I don't see anything superficial about it unless your life becomes very materialistic.
If materialistic knowledge is power, it is not wisdom. It is but a blind force.
